item.title: Wedding
item.description: Arnav and Fanny are getting married. Stay tuned for updates on the location, time, and whether or not you’re invited.

item.title: writing
item.description: For anything writing-related, please email writing@arnavsood.com Fiction “Local Perturbation” — Daily Science Fiction. Non-Fiction “Bounded Rationality” — Blanket Sea. Pushcart Prize nominee.

item.title: links
item.description: Some things I think are worth sharing. Scientific American: North American bird populations have declined 29% since 1970. NPR: As recently as 1960, fish used to be huge. WIPP: How to warn people 10000 years from now about radioactive waste. Sylvia Jacobson: Was confined to a skyjacked plane for a week, and wrote a paper about it. Ken Liu: State Change (short story). 129 Cars: This American Life (WBEZ Chicago) spends a month at a car dealership.

item.title: about
item.description: I’m an economics research programmer and writer, based in Vancouver BC. My most recent appointment was as a Predoctoral Fellow in Economics at UBC, working primarily with Jesse Perla on computational macro. I’m also part of the team at QuantEcon, where I work on Julia and infrastructure projects. My email’s asood@alumni.ubc.ca. If you prefer to communicate securely, here’s my PGP public key.
